page.title: 11LOCAL CRAFTS IN ILMINGTON
page.content: 1.{Hurdle-making.}Willow wood from local farms is used and hurdles are sent all over the British Isles. Climbing frames,gates and seats are also made.A man,his wife and one other person is employed in this craft. 2.{Flower-drying} .Helipterum,Xeranthemum,Acanthus and Alliums are grown and dried at Armscote Manor.They are used for bouquets and flower arrangements.Quite a few local women are employed in this craft (especially in the Christmas season). 3.{Welding&Metalwork}.A man makes hooks,baskets and metal decorations to order. 4.{Builders}.There are two local family firms (Meredith and Turville). 5.{Farmers}.Local farmers employ their sons,labourers and seasonal help.
